plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: A popular flowering plant known for its vibrant, daisy-like blooms that signal the arrival of autumn in many temperate gardens.
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are highly symbolic in East Asia, representing longevity and rejuvenation, and are often featured in traditional festivals.

plants.name: Protea cynaroides
plants.description: South Africa's national flower, it features large, striking blooms with a central cone surrounded by spiky petals, often resembling a giant artichoke.
plants.funFact: The King Protea is named after the Greek god Proteus, symbolizing diversity and transformation because of its varied forms.

plants.name: Solidago canadensis
plants.description: A tall, herbaceous perennial with bright yellow flower clusters that attract bees and butterflies in late summer and fall.
plants.location: North America (wild), naturalized in parts of Europe and Asia
plants.funFact: Although sometimes blamed for hay fever, goldenrod pollen is too heavy to be airborne; ragweed blooming at the same time is the usual culprit.

plants.name: Camellia sasanqua
plants.description: An evergreen shrub valued for its fragrant, delicate flowers that appear in early autumn, brightening gardens before most other camellias bloom.
plants.location: Japan, East Asia; widely cultivated in temperate zones
plants.funFact: Sasanqua camellias were originally used in Japan for oil extraction before becoming favored ornamental plants.
